oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Exit from ownership: Do you have a plan?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McCormick, David
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: veterinary
practice ownership
strategic planning
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Planning for your exit can make a significant difference as to how and when you exit as well as what your practice may be worth. The checklists and information discussed in this presentation are guides to prepare for an exit from ownership. The exit could involve selling the practice to another veterinarian that does not work in the practice. It could also involve selling all, or part of your practice to a current associate doctor. Having a known buyer helps to define the timeline and potential transition issues.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 237-238
